content.title: First steps
content.desc: My very first time 'coding' was on this program called PSeint, a program where you can make really basic algorithyms for learning purposes.

content.title: Meeting Java
content.desc: I did two semesters of Java on my university. I even learned some OOP.
I used to make my own Java basic programs after my classes, I discovered how fun coding could be.

content.title: HTML and CSS
content.desc: In march, I saw some basic HTML and CSS at my university. That day, as soon as I got to my house, I started learning more about it by myself.
Post card (03/05).
Disney+ login page clone (03/17).

content.title: Game Development
content.desc: Web Development first era didn't last long as I started to focus on Game Development.
In april, I made my first game on Unity C#. It was a platformer with some basic combat system, there's no much to say about it.
Practice game (04/11).

content.title: First real game
content.desc: Days later, I started working on a team project for my university. We had to develop a game within the next few months. I was in charge of the coding.
The game was called Elixir Quest, a platformer game where you have to travel and fight against enemies to find the elixir at the end of the way.
Elixir Quest (05/21).
Elixir Quest (06/02).
After finishing Elixir Quest and some weeks of rest, I continued with my game development learning path. I started making clones, just for practicing.
Flappy Bird Clone (06/19).
Super Mario Bros Clone (06/27).

content.title: First own game
content.desc: I wanted to make my own game from scratch so I started working on Dizzy Cat, a game where you have to solve puzzles by rotating the scenario.
After almost three months of development, I finally finished the game.
Dizzy Cat (10/13).

content.title: Back on Websites
content.desc: I wanted to give it another try to web development so I started to review HTML and CSS, remaking some old projects.

content.title: JavaScript
content.desc: Doing static pages was good but I needed to be able to add interactivity to them. Then I discovered JavaScript and started learning it right after.
Hangman (01/31).
Color Sequence (02/02).
Tic Tac Toe (02/06).
Music Player (02/17).
Rick and Morty API (02/26).

content.title: Alpha Timeline Creator
content.desc: After all those projects I started working on the first version of this very app in vanilla JavaScript.
First version of Timeline Creator (04/18).
As soon as I tried React, I completely fell in love with it. Doing UI for more complex projects was way fresher than in vanilla JavaScript.
Weather App (05/03).
IP Geolocation (05/15).
Emoji Finder (05/22).
After some weeks, I started learning NodeJS and MongoDB. This was the first step for making more complete websites.
URL Shortener (06/02).

content.title: Making a bigger project
content.desc: Then I decided to go for a bigger project. I wanted it to be a Fullstack project so I started working on Quizzie.

content.title: Quizzie
content.desc: Quizzie is a web application where you can create your own quizzes and share them with others.
This is how playing a quiz looks like. You have to select the only right answer before time runs out.
The creation page is made to the detail to give the user the best experience and customization for their quizzes.
On july 27th and after almost two months of development, Quizzie was finally released. I learned a lot from this project, specially with user auth.
